page.title: 17Haulage Contractors
page.content: The Grandfather and Father of the present Directors, Arnold and Derek Pawson, began the Company in 1921, with two horses and carts.They delivered home coal, emptied dustbins and middens. Today 20 heavy goods vehicles are in service, travelling throughout the U.K. 32 employees travel in from nearby towns and villages to work.The Warehouse and Distribution side of the Business deals mainly with imported fruit and vegetables from South Africa, New Zealand,Cyprus, Spain and Israel.These goods are collected from the ports and stored until distributed to supermarkets and markets as required.The Company has its own maintenance depot to service the vehicles, and a diesel store. A new Volvo F10 costs Â£32,500 and a tautliner trailer Â£10,500.
